alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 10:37PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Orleans, southeastern St. Tammany Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and southwestern Hancock Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1037 PM CDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm near Slidell, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Public report of dime sized hail in Eden Isle. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Lake Catherine and Pearlington. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 259 and 272. Interstate 12 between mile markers 83 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana near mile marker 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Orleans; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany
